result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. Bieser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C. Bieser

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Amy. 
Case called: 8:31 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for ADA Mayo.
Defendant appears by video from Focus House Detention Facility with Attorney Natasha VanLieshout in person.  

COURT performs colloquy on right to appear in person for plea hearing; Defendant waives right to appear in person. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to AMEND Count 1 (Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm) to Disorderly Conduct under 947.01(1); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 78 days MCJ with 78 days credit.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

Adj: 8:43 a.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
